page.title: 13Lifestyles in Eccleshall
page.content: Once a market town, Eccleshall is traditionally a meeting place for country people and has a large number of inns in relation to population. Seven now remain, but the lack of continuity in management in recent years shows that it is increasingly difficult for publicans to make a good living. All now provide bar snacks; some have restaurants; and there is one cafe. Although general wear is country clothing, shopping facilities have improved to the extent that local ladies have a choice of high-class dress shops, hairdressers and beauty salons. Strangely the gentlemen seem sartorially neglected, but perhaps the local betting shop is some compens- ation. Eccleshall typifies many country towns: pleasant, friendly, welcoming, with a wholesome and enviable way of life.
